Questions: A circular linked list can be used for
What differentiates a circular linked list from a normal linked list?
Choices: You cannot have the ‘next’ pointer point to null in a circular linked list
It is faster to traverse the circular linked list
You may or may not have the ‘next’ pointer point to null in a circular linked list
Head node is known in circular linked list

Questions: What do you call an edge which starts and ends at the same vertex?
In graph theory, a loop ___ and ___ at the ___ vertex.
Choices: does not start, does not end, same
Explanations: Explanation: In a graph, vertices are connected by lines or curves known as edges. An edge that connects a vertex to itself is called a loop.
Explanation: In a graph, vertices are connected by lines or curves known as edges. An edge that connects a vertex to itself is called a loop.

Questions: The top most node when dealing with a tree data structure is known as
In data structures, tree theory states that the very first or top most node is called ____
Explanations: Explanation:  A tree is a hierarchical data structure consisting of nodes connected by edges. The very first or topmost node is known as the root node. The tree originates from this root node and hence, has no parents

Explanation: A tree is a hierarchical data structure consisting of nodes connected by edges. The very first or topmost node is known as the root node. The tree originates from this root node and hence, has no parents.

Questions: In which access should a constructor be defined, so that object of the class can be created in any function?
Which access specifier is used where one wants data members to be accessed by other classes but not from outside objects?
Explanations: No Explanation
No Explanation

Questions: Which of the following is a true statement regarding a constructor?
Which of the following is a false statement regarding a constructor?
Choices: its return type changes based on how you write it
Name varies from the class name
Automatically executed whenever an object of a class is created
Has the same name with the class
Explanations: Explanation: A constructor doesn't return any values explicitly, it returns the instance of the class to which it belongs
Explanation: A constructor is a member function of a class that has the same name as the class name

Questions: What does OOP stand for?
Object-oriented programming(OOP) has four basic concepts. Which one does not belong?
Explanations: Explanation:Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a computer programming model that organizes software design around data, or objects, rather than functions and logic.
Explanation: Object-oriented programming has four basic concepts which includes encapsulation, abstraction, inheritance, and polymorphism.

Questions: Exposing only the necessary information to the user in Object Oriented Programming is known as
Which of the following is not a true statement when discussing the concept of Abstraction?
Choices: Only essential attributes are illustrated to the user
Avoids code duplication and increases reusability
All attributes and unnecessary details are shown to the user
Unnecessary details are hidden from the user
Explanations: Explanation: In Object Oriented Programming Abstraction is a concept which is concerned with showing only the essential attributes to the user and hides any unnecessary details.
Explanation: In Object Oriented Programming Abstraction is a concept which is concerned with showing only the essential attributes to the user and hides any unnecessary details.

Questions: Accessing an array in almost all programming languages is denoted by using
What kind of bracketing is most commonly used by almost all programming languages when denoting array access?
Explanations: Explanation: The kind of bracketing used in almost all programming languages in order to denote array access is the square brackets.
Explanation: The kind of bracketing used in almost all programming languages in order to denote array access is the square brackets.

Questions: Which string will be accepted by the regular expression? 1(00)*1
Which regular expression accepts this string? 100001
Explanations: The string must start and end with a singular 1, so A and D can be eliminated. The string can only have 0 or even pairs of zeros, eliminating C. This leaves B as the correct answer.
The expression must start with a 1 and end with 1 so B can be eliminated. D can only produce an odd number of 0s, so it can be eliminated. Answer A ends with more than a singular 1, leaving answer C.

Questions: Which of the following search/sort algorithms has the average time complexity of O(log(n))?
Binary search has what time complexity?
Explanations: Explanation: Linear search can only search elements 1 by 1 (O(n)). Bubble sort must traverse the entire array after each element causing O(n^2).
No Explanation

Questions: Stack is what type of data structure
Queue is is what type of data structure
Explanations: The element inserted at the last is the first element to come out first.
The element inserted at the first, is the first element to come out of the list.

Questions: What does SDLC stand for?
This cycle defines a methodology for improving the quality of software and the overall development process
Explanations: Explanation: The Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) refers to a methodology with clearly defined processes for creating high-quality software.
Explanation: The Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) refers to a methodology with clearly defined processes for creating high-quality software.

Questions: In Software Engineering, which of the following would be considered a functional requirement?
Which one of the following would fall under the concept of a non-functional requirement in Software Engineering?
Choices: Deposit money in a Banking System
Loan processing in a Banking System
Cash withdrawal in a Banking System
Deposit money in a Banking System
Explanations: Explanation: In Software Engineering, a functional requirement aims at defining how the system must work whereas, a non-functional requirement aims at defining how the system should perform
Explanation: In Software Engineering, a functional requirement aims at defining how the system must work whereas, a non-functional requirement aims at defining how the system should perform

Questions: In Software Engineering, when collaborating with customers it is important to define which of the following?
Which of the following is not defined when collaborating with customers?
Explanations: Explanation: All of the following are defined when collaborating with customers. It is crucial to define the system’s inputs as well as the outputs, important software components or features and various usage scenarios when working with customers. They all fall into this category.

Explanation: All of the following are defined when collaborating with customers. It is crucial to define the system’s inputs as well as the outputs, important software components or features and various usage scenarios when working with customers. They all fall into this category.

Questions: Which of the following best defines what an Agile scrum methodology is?
An Agile scrum methodology is defined in Software engineering as a
Choices: project management that emphasizes decremental progress
project management that emphasizes neutral progress
project management that emphasizes incremental progress
project management that emphasizes no progress
project management that emphasizes neutral progress
project management that emphasizes no progress
project management that emphasizes decremental progress
project management that emphasizes incremental progress
Explanations: Explanation: In Software engineering, an Agile scrum methodology is defined as a style of project management that emphasizes incremental progress. The goal is to complete the most important features first by dividing each iteration into two to four-week sprints, with the intention to have a deliverable product at the end of each sprint.

Explanation: In Software engineering, an Agile scrum methodology is defined as a style of project management that emphasizes incremental progress. The goal is to complete the most important features first by dividing each iteration into two to four-week sprints, with the intention to have a deliverable product at the end of each sprint.

Questions: What does the abbreviation RAD stand for?
RAD is an agile development method also known as
Explanations: Explanation: Rapid Application Development (RAD) is an agile development method used in Software engineering which places less emphasis on planning tasks and more emphasis on iterative development for the purpose of accomplishing a quick turnaround and high-end outcomes

Explanation: Rapid Application Development (RAD) is an agile development method used in Software engineering which places less emphasis on planning tasks and more emphasis on iterative development for the purpose of accomplishing a quick turnaround and high-end outcomes
